paper_title: Topological Hochschild homology, truncated Brown-Peterson spectra, and a topological Sen operator
abstract: In this article, we study the topological Hochschild homology of $\mathbf{E}_3$-forms of truncated Brown-Peterson spectra, taken relative to certain Thom spectra $X(p^n)$ (introduced by Ravenel and used by Devinatz-Hopkins-Smith in the proof of the nilpotence theorem). We prove analogues of Bökstedt's calculations $\mathrm{THH}(\mathbf{F}_p) \simeq \mathbf{F}_p[ΩS^3]$ and $\mathrm{THH}(\mathbf{Z}_p) \simeq \mathbf{Z}_p[ΩS^3\langle{3}\rangle]$. We also construct a topological analogue of the Sen operator of Bhatt-Lurie-Drinfeld, and study a higher chromatic extension. The behavior of these "topological Sen operators" is dictated by differentials in the Serre spectral sequence for Cohen-Moore-Neisendorfer fibrations.
publication_venue: 99 pages, one figure. The present article is far from being a final version, so any comments and suggestions for improvement are greatly appreciated. I'll post major updates to the arXiv, but I'll upload minor edits to my website; so please see there for the most up-to-date version
